oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THERMAL-EXPANSION OF ORTHORHOMBIC AND TETRAGONAL PHASES OF THE HIGH T(C) SUPERCONDUCTORS RE1BA2CU3OY (RE = Y, GD, DY)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PRAKASH, OM
RAO, A
PRAKASH, O
DHEER, PN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: tc
yba2cu3o7
magnetostriction
dependence
heat
thermal expansion
high temperature superconductors
discontinuity in alpha
growth conditions
iodometric titration
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Measurements of the coefficient of linear thermal expansion alpha have been carried out for the orthorhombic and tetragonal phases of RE1Ba2Cu3Oy(RE = Y, Gd, Dy) compounds using a high resolution capacitance dilatometer in the temperature range 77-300 K. All the superconducting samples exhibit a jump DELTAalpha at their respective transition temperatures, T(c). Evidences of, sample-to-sample variation in alpha values and dependence of DELTAalpha on the sample preparation conditions, have been obtained. The non-superconducting samples, in general, exhibit lower values of alpha possibly because of lowering of oxygen content.
